revised_title: Roman Inscription and Genius Deity of York
tldr: The author, Ralph Thoresby, shares the discovery of a Roman inscription found in York. The inscription is dedicated to the Genius, or tutelary deity, of the place. Thoresby discusses the history and significance of the Roman monument, as well as the customs of deifying genii and assigning gods for the protection of cities in ancient times. He also mentions various medals and their inscriptions related to these practices.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology and Antiquity
